title: Scrolling lag on a system with a Nvidia GPU
content:
Hey, after using chrome for a couple of years, i decided to give Firefox a go and while it has been really snappy so far, there's an issue where scrolling and all animations run at ~80fps tops on my 144hz 1440p monitor. Due to a mismatch in frame time, no animation looks smooth at this frame rate on my display unfortunately. This behavior is exaggerated when running firefox maximized, as the frame rate is noticeably higher when running on a smaller window.

I've had a similar issue in the past on an older Nvidia GPU, where the driver wasn't upping the GPU clock automatically on firefox, so i decided to force max clocks on the GPU yet i didn't notice a performane difference this time. I've also tried running running firefox in troubleshooting mode and have tried firefox nightly with no extensions, to no avail in both cases. Hardware acceleration is enabled on my system and nothing on about:support would indicate it's opting for software rendering instead, so I'm unsure as to how to go on troubleshooting this issue.

The GPU is a Geforce 1660 Super on a Ryzen 5 3600 powered system, so i guess it should be able to do smooth hardware acceleration as it (mostly) does on chrome and electron powered apps.
creator: christos.ath4

title: CSP error while access DUO Auth - Please image attached
content:
We've tried well over 20 different troubleshooting steps, even uninstall/ reinstall + private browser. Personal PC with McAfee installed (end user is very hesitant on disabling it temporarily). 

Few things here:

1: CSP reports "The page's settings blocked the loading of a resource at self" although all resources are loaded

Content Security Policy (CSP) is an added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate certain types of attacks, including Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks. These attacks are used for everything from data theft, to site defacement, to malware distribution. Options: 1) Disable tracking protection - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enhanced-tracking-protection-firefox-desktop 2) I will try disabling all extensions. 3) General --> about:config --> network.dns.disableipv6 = True ---> OR network.dns.disablePrefetch = True (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nGb0BQKdAtU) 4) Clear cache + cookies


2: DUO support ticket: 01062926

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CSP

I just realized the end user has McAfee installed. I will whitelist *duosecurity.com


3: So I found with a DUO representative, an existing escalation for this exact issue and the resolution came down to this being a bug with Firefox that involves CSP restrictions being applied to WebSDKv2 Applications when injecting iframes, which is exactly what is happening when Duo prompts pop up for this website. The resolution for this was to contact Mozilla support to walk you through disabling the CSP restrictions or allowing an exception.

I investigated further and found that it has something to do with the user's settings conflicting with the settings the web applications page is trying to enforce. I also read that Google Chrome and other browsers do not enforce this, which is probably why this is only happening on Firefox for him.

This leads me to assume that there is a good chance that McAfee or some other setting on his device is causing this to occur and explains why he is only seeing this issue with Firefox.

I did see some people mention this only happens when entering a passcode into the 2FA prompt, so maybe have this user try the Duo Push option for 2FA (if he hasn't already) and see if that works.



Any assistance will be greatly appreciated. Very curious what's going on. Chrome, edge and other browsers work completely fine. End user is persistent that he wants to use FireFox over any other browser. Like I said, we tried various of workarounds that I can't fully place within this post.

Thank you for your time!

title: Arr... how do i turn this off?!
content:
Firefox Updates:

Automatically install updates (recommended) = OFF When Firefox is not running = OFF (It's on but greyed out because of the above setting) Check for updates but let you choose to install them = ON

Is it normal that firefox still creates this "telemetry" folder even when auto updates are OFF? C:\ProgramData\Mozilla-1de4eec8-1241-4177-a854-e594e9c1fb38 UpdateLock-CA7422744AE1A41C

C:\ProgramData\Mozilla-1de4eec8-1241-4177-a854-e594e9c1fb38\updates\CA7422744AE1A41C update-config.json {"__DEFAULTS__":{"app.update.auto":true,"app.update.background.enabled":true},"app.update.auto":false}

As suggested i added these two lines to firefox.cfg lockPref("app.update.background.enabled", false); lockPref("app.update.background.scheduling.enabled", false); Seem like firefox doesn't give a ****? How can i once and for all fully disable both these settings? Automatically install updates (recommended) = OFF When Firefox is not running = OFF


By the way, during the installation i DID NOT install the maintenance service, so why exactly is the exe in the directory anyways??

title: MS word will only prompt for download and not open
content:
I download many pdf and Word files each day for marking. Opening pdf files in Adobe Reader works automatically OK, but Word files no. This archived question gives a link to an answer that does not work. "If Firefox does not have a set download action for a type of file, Firefox will save the file by default. If you select Always Open Similar Files in the Downloads panel right-click context menu for the file, (see below) a new Content Type and Action entry will be added to the General panel Applications section of Firefox settings." I went through the Always Open step, but no "Content Type and Action entry" was added.

Judging by the questions in Firefox and more widely, many people are having the same problem. Why cannot the industry standard file types be added to that list by default?

creator: DukeStallion

title: Firefox 2FA will not accept 6-digit codes
content:
I have tried both Google Authenticator and Guardian for use with Mozilla 2FA. I have tried scanning the QR code on my PC multiple times on each authentication app and retrieving multiple codes each time, but all entries stated "incorrect 6 digit code" on my PC to enable 2FA. I am not sure how this is not working. Both authenticator apps identified my correct login email address associated with my Mozilla account so I know it must have something to do with whatever is happening on the back end at Mozilla for my account.

Also, I have read a few posts in the Mozilla support knowledgebase regarding this very same issue, but did not see any resolution. I would really like to have 2FA. Can someone please contact me about this?
creator: carlod

title: Virus in navegator
content: A Yahoo search engine, called Browser Default, took over my browser. Firefox have not been able to give me information or assistance on how to remove it.
creator: adiaz65

title: 2 tabs using 6 GB of RAM.
content:
I have two idle tabs (no videos or other active components) open and according to Task Manager on my PC, it says Firefox is using 6 GB of memory. Unfathomably high number.

The Firefox Process Manager says the GPU (whatever that is) is using 5 GB of memory.

I did all the usual quick fixes (Restart, update, restart PC, refresh, disable add ons, etc.)

Please help. Why is 2 tabs none of which is a video tab using 6 GB of memory?
creator: mjwu7185

title: firefox is storing my bank account number
content: Hi, when I log into my bank I give my account number and then a password. I have told firefox not to remember my password but it is remembering the bank account number which automatically pops up when I am on the banks log in page. How do I stop this? Also when I signed up for this firefox help it asked for an email address and all my email addresses poped up for me to chose from. I didn't like this either. Appreciate any help. If these features can't be turned off whats the last version I can use that won't do this? cheers Neil
creator: ihatespam666

title: I can no longer install extensions outside from github or any other 3rd party site. Getting "this add-on could not be downloaded because of a connection failure"
content:
^topic, I can no longer download any extension outside of the official firefox site.

I noticed yesterday when I created a new firefox profile that I couldn't download 3rd party extensions. This also affects my main profile and creating a new profile have the same issue. This is the error I'm getting: https://puu.sh/JqAIh/0854801832.png

I'm running Firefox Nighlty 108.0a1 (2022-11-01) (64-bit), windows 10 64bit professional OS.

Manually saving the plugin and drag and drop still works, but directly clicking download doesn't.

Any idea on how to fix this?

title: How do I sort my bookmarks by date properly?
content: I have a lot of bookmarks, they use to be sorted by date, but now they are sorted randomly after I changed computers. If I click control shift O it brings up the bookmarks, now I know you can go under "views" then "sort", then "added", but that still does not sort it properly. I just recently bookmarked a random page, tagging with a name so I remember which one it is. Now if I do this correctly that new bookmark I made should either be on the bottom or the top of the page after I sort it. But that is not the case. It's just mixed in somewhere in the middle. I tried sorting a few different ways, but no luck. PLEASE HELP!
